Dear Sir/Madam,
My name is Emily Craigie and I'm writing from LBC Radio. I hope you're well.
I am writing with a request under the Freedom of Information Act. Could I ask, for the financial years 2018-19, 22-23 and 23-24:
1.	How much did your local authority spend on providing residential placements to children taken into the council's care? Please provide a breakdown for each year, including a projected spend for the rest of 23-24 if it is available.
2.	Of that figure, how much of the figure was spent on private-sector residential placements? Again, please provide a breakdown for each year and include a projected spend for the rest of 23-24 if it is available.
3.	How many children were taken into the council's care for each financial year?
Could I get this information in an Excel spreadsheet.
I am happy to discuss further over the phone - my number is 07557187585 - and thanks for your consideration.
Yours Faithfully,
Emily Craigie

Dear Emily Craigie,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Children's social

This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
Before we can begin to process your FOI Request, we would like to clarify
what information you require.
Could you please clarify the questions asked as they can be interpreted in
different ways which would give very different answers.
Such as: The costs of all internal / external placements in that year
(including new and existing placements) or the costs in those financial
years purely for placements starting in those years?
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to a
request within 20 working days. The 20 working day clock will start the
day after we receive the necessary clarification.
You can provide your clarification by replying to this email. Please
note, if clarification is not received within 2 months your Freedom of
Information request will be closed.
We look forward to hearing from you.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
